description: [Status: stable] [Name: invalid-str-return-type] [Message: __str__ does not return str] What it does Checks for __str__ implementations that return a type other than str. Why is this bad? The __str__ method should return a str object. Returning a different type may cause unexpected behavior. Example class Foo: def __str__(self): return True Use instead: class Foo: def __str__(self): return "Foo"
